results.title: Anti-Cancer Council ad: 'Have a fag'
results.brief_description: This television advertisment made by the Anti-Cancer Council of Victoria (now Cancer Council Victoria) formed part of the first Australian anti-tobacco advertising campaign which launched on 5 June 1971. Taking a stark and satirical tone, this campaign aimed to undermine the glamourisation of smoking created by cigarette company advertising.
results.description: This television advertisment made by the Anti-Cancer Council of Victoria (now Cancer Council Victoria) formed part of the first Australian anti-tobacco advertising campaign which launched on 5 June 1971. results.title: Frontline Afghanistan: A Tribute to Raffaele Favero (1945-83)
results.brief_description: A television documentary that pays tribute to Italian born camera operator, Raffaele Favero, who was killed while filming the war in Afghanistan. The film is also a very intimate account of the effect of his death on his wife and children in Australia.
results.title_for_label: Frontline Afghanistan: A Tribute to Raffaele Favero (1945-83)

results.title: [Maryborough mudbrick dome]
results.brief_description:
Film showing the construction of a mudbrick hut with domed roof in Maryborough, central Victoria. The hut sits alongside the Maryborough Centenary Reserve, just off Stoneham Drive.

The hut was constructed during a week long workshop with Melbourne arhitecture students and local sustainability enthusiasts including Bill Mollison. The project was featured in ‘The Owner Builder” issue 5 and was overseen by Nepalese architect, Ramesh Manandhar, who is interviewed in the film.

The soundtrack is intermittent.

results.title: Pierre et Paul = Pierre and Paul
results.creator_credit: Rene Allio, Leon Carre and Yves Robert
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a middle manager in a building company, decides to buy a appartment and live with his girlfriend, Martine. But, the subsequent death of his father and various financial difficulties soon damage his mental equilibrium. When the May ‘68 riots errupt, Pierre goes off the rails.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre, Yves Robert ; director, Rene Allio ; writer, Rene Allio ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Jacques Dutronc.
Cast: Pierre Mondy, Robert Juillard, Bulle Ogier, Madeleine Barbulee, Helene Vincent.
